name: TheAtlantic
text: Jacinda Ardern’s victory foreshadows the challenge facing all world leaders in the months and years ahead, writes @YasmeenSerhan. Though succeeding in the face of the pandemic is hard, dealing with its aftermath could be harder. https://t.co/0DdRVhVRQr

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Jacinda Ardern showed the world how leading a country through a global health crisis is done. Today, New Zealanders rewarded her with a historic majority. 

But if succeeding in the face of the pandemic is hard, dealing with its aftermath could be harder:
https://t.co/Zgw6SXFJjn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Everyone’s favourite world leader just won re-election. Yet, as ⁦@YasmeenSerhan⁩ writes in ⁦@TheAtlantic⁩, successfully managing the pandemic may not be the hardest part of Jacinda Ardern’s job. https://t.co/cgU1nWlxSX

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: When wealth inequality is increasing and the spaces where humans can live comfortably are shrinking, the heat gap between rich and poor might be the world’s most daunting challenge, Vann R. Newkirk II writes. https://t.co/BAezp3p7Nj

name: TheAtlantic

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Over the past decade,” Ruth S. Barrett writes, “the for-profit ecosystem that has sprouted up around athletic recruiting at top-rung universities has grown so excessively ornate, so circular in its logic, that it’s become self-defeating.” https://t.co/VmiHByh7Rz
